parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have come, be present, have arrived. A primary verb; to arrive, i.e. Be present.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to rush, i.e. to sacrifice; by extension to immolate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fattened, fatted. From a derivative of sitos; grain-fed, i.e. Fattened.
A calf, heifer, young bull. Probably strengthened for oschos; a young bullock.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and lambano; to receive; also to take aside.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
